title: The ‘logistical black hole’ blocking Alcatraz's rebuilding
author: Josh Niland

Photo: © Radomianin / Wikimedia Commons / CC BY-SA 4.0 So much for a remake of 'The Rock', experts say. SFGATE is tracking the Trump Administration’s murmurs for a future modernization of the prison complex at Alcatraz Island, which closed to the public in 1963 and has since become a National Parks Service property that generates an estimated $60 million in tourism revenues each year. On its own, the "plan" itself is hard to estimate or even, for some experts, take seriously, as it could distract from a more subtle push to reopen other federal prison facilities in the area.  The last (early-60s) estimate had set repair costs at around $5 million. That number amounts to approximately $52.2 million in today's currency. There is currently an active debate over the reuse of prisons in architecture circles. Ai Weiwei last reused the site ironically as a "celebration of liberty" back in 2014.

    The former recreation yard at Alcatraz Island. Photo: © Radomianin / Wikimedia Commons / CC BY-SA 4.0

    So much for a remake of 'The Rock', experts say. SFGATE is tracking the Trump Administration’s murmurs for a future modernization of the prison complex at Alcatraz Island, which closed to the public in 1963 and has since become a National Parks Service property that generates an estimated $60 million in tourism revenues each year. On its own, the "plan" itself is hard to estimate or even, for some experts, take seriously, as it could distract from a more subtle push to reopen other federal prison facilities in the area. 

    The last (early-60s) estimate had set repair costs at around $5 million. That number amounts to approximately $52.2 million in today's currency. There is currently an active debate over the reuse of prisons in architecture circles. Ai Weiwei last reused the site ironically as a "celebration of liberty" back in 2014.
